intro: Acroceras oryzoides, commonly known as the rice grass or rice-leaved rush, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Cyperaceae. It is characterized by its slender, grass-like stems and narrow, linear leaves that resemble rice grains, hence its common name. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets, typical of the sedge family. It thrives in wet or moist environments, often found in marshes, swamps, and along the edges of water bodies. Acroceras oryzoides plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various aquatic and terrestrial organisms.
